publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5095 Mr John Swinney: The Watson-Watt Society of Brechin—That the Parliament welcomes the establishment of the Watson-Watt Society of Brechin and congratulates the society on its plans to commemorate the work of Sir Robert Watson-Watt, the father of radar; notes that Sir Robert was born in Brechin and educated at Damacre School and Brechin High; acknowledges the enormous contribution Sir Robert made to the development of radar; recognises the importance of radar in our society through its use in weather forecasting, air traffic control, speed cameras, space travel and other uses, and encourages the Watson-Watt Society in its fund-raising efforts to establish a memorial to Sir Robert in Brechin as a tribute to the significance of his contribution to science in general and radar in particular.

S2M-5095 The Watson-Watt Society of Brechin (lodged on 6 November 2006) Murdo Fraser*, Ms Sandra White*, Christine Grahame*, Stewart Stevenson*, Alex Neil*, Mr David Davidson*, Bruce Crawford*, Robin Harper*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Fergus Ewing*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Andrew Welsh*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Rob Gibson*, Jim Mather*, Nora Radcliffe*, Phil Gallie*, Tricia Marwick*, Brian Adam*, Alex Johnstone*, Ms Maureen Watt*
S2M-5095 The Watson-Watt Society of Brechin (lodged on 6 November 2006) Eleanor Scott*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, John Swinburne*, Trish Godman*, Mr Jamie Stone*

S2M-5095 Mr John Swinney: The Watson-Watt Society of Brechin—That the Parliament welcomes the establishment of the Watson-Watt Society of Brechin and congratulates the society on its plans to commemorate the work of Sir Robert Watson-Watt, the father of radar; notes that Sir Robert was born in Brechin and educated at Damacre School and Brechin High; acknowledges the enormous contribution Sir Robert made to the development of radar; recognises the importance of radar in our society through its use in weather forecasting, air traffic control, speed cameras, space travel and other uses, and encourages the Watson-Watt Society in its fund-raising efforts to establish a memorial to Sir Robert in Brechin as a tribute to the significance of his contribution to science in general and radar in particular. Supported by: Murdo Fraser, Ms Sandra White, Christine Grahame, Stewart Stevenson, Alex Neil, Mr David Davidson, Bruce Crawford, Robin Harper, Roseanna Cunningham, Fergus Ewing, Richard Lochhead, Mr Andrew Welsh, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Rob Gibson, Jim Mather, Nora Radcliffe, Phil Gallie, Tricia Marwick, Brian Adam, Alex Johnstone, Ms Maureen Watt, Eleanor Scott, Ms Rosemary Byrne, John Swinburne, Trish Godman, Mr Jamie Stone, Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-5095 The Watson-Watt Society of Brechin (lodged on 6 November 2006) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-5095 The Watson-Watt Society of Brechin (lodged on 6 November 2006) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-5095 The Watson-Watt Society of Brechin (lodged on 6 November 2006) Michael Matheson*
S2M-5095 The Watson-Watt Society of Brechin (lodged on 6 November 2006) Shiona Baird*
